data.title: Minimap - Scroll immediately when mouse button held down
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows

Currently the minimap-position will jump to where the mouse is clicked on the minimap bar. However, to scrub from there, you need to release the mouse button and click again, then drag. It'd be better if when clicked and held, one could immediately scrub through the minimap.

data.title: launch.json/task.json changes not always used when launching
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11 insiders
- OS Version: Ubuntu-14, Windows 10, and OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make a change to launch.json or a task that launch.json references through `preLaunchTask`.
2. Immediately hit F5 to start debugging

Expected:
Current version of the file should be used

Actual:
Most of the time on my box the old version is used and I need to launch again.

This seems to be related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3132, but I am not sure if maybe that fix was insufficient or if it just regressed again.

data.title: [loc][Query][VSCode] Please clarify localizability for words in quotes

**Query:**
Please confirm if the parts in quotes should be localized or not. We assume that `editor.wordWrap` and 'wordWrapColumn should not be localized, but what about 'bounded'? Thanks!

data.title: Give an option to show files before directories in file explorer
data.body:
There are project structures which would greatly benefit from being able to show the files of a directory before other subdirectories inside them. This is what I see for example in a project of mine (an Ember application using the POD structure)

![screen shot 2017-03-13 at 14 32 44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/166692/23856551/5962d524-07fa-11e7-88ac-5363d98ba875.png)

As you can see there's a lot of repetions, names wise, which gives quite a bad overview of the whole components structure. If the `component.js` and `template.hbs` would appear before any other "sub-components" directory, it would increase the readability of the structure.

data.title: Relative paths sometimes not included as links in integrated terminal
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:  1.10.2
- OS Version: Mac OSX (10.11.6)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code integrated terminal
2. Echo a relative path (eg. ```echo "src/app.js"```)

Description:

Let's say you have a build system that outputs a stack trace on a build error or failed test. If this was run from the integrated terminal, the file paths in the output should be included as clickable links which can be clicked to open the file in VSCode.

However, this only works if the path is either an absolute path (e.g. ```~/work/project/src/app.js```) or a relative path that begins with "./". 

Many build systems and tools output file paths relative to the directory the command was run, without the leading "./", Karma for example. So the output would be something like: ```src/app.js```, not ```./src/app.js```. The first is not matched by VSCode as an openable path, but the second is.

I believe that what is determined to be a path comes from the Regex in "terminalLinkHandler.ts"

Is there a reason why relative paths of this form (e.g. no leading "./") are not included?

data.title: rename of unsaved new file erases all so far edited contents.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

'rename' of unsaved new file erases its content in open editor.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Win7 SP1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create new File ( .h)
2. edit file contents but do not save
3. on project window select in context-menu 'rename file'
4. All edits are gone !!!!

data.title: Shell syntax broken on code embedded in string
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
```
Version 1.10.2
Commit 8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331
Date 2017-03-08T14:00:46.854Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
```
- OS Version:
```
$ lsb_release -idrc
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS
Release:	16.04
Codename:	xenial
```
Embedding shell code in string breaks syntax scheme on word "function" below:

![zrzut ekranu z 2017-03-13 13-21-34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/141999/23854080/07654c0c-07f0-11e7-8a88-002a81bfbb9f.png)

This is consistent across all colour themes.

Test case:

```
    if ! fnExists "platform_${__platform}"; then
        fatalError "Set the __platform variable: $(compgen -A function platform_ | cut -b10- | paste -s -d' ')"
    fi
```

data.title: No notification on newer Version availability.
data.body:
Recently while troubleshooting task.json file I learned about the newer version of code from @dbaeumer, vscode never notified me on the availability of newer version.

(At that time I was using 1.8.1, on Mac Sierra)

Vscode should notify user when a new version has been pushed live.

(yes, even after changing `update.channel: "none"`).

data.title: C language syntax highlighting breaks after declaring pointer to function argument
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 8
- Extensions:  cpptools / ms-vscode / 0.10.3
- Language: C

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create .c or .h file
2. Declare function with the pointer to function argument (just type something similar to):
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25171239/23846168/3045ce48-07dd-11e7-891c-63673aab04eb.png)
arguments types (I tried char, int, long, void) are not highlighted after the pointer to function argument. Type modifiers (const) are highlighted.

data.title: BUG : jsconfig.json file in $HOME crash computer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:
_linked to #22372_

1. Close vscode
2. create `jsconfig.json` file in your $HOME directory with content : 
```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "lib": [
            "es2015"
        ]
    }
}
```
3. launch any project of vscode and check your processor activity : 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5599375/23849423/db71b45a-07db-11e7-82da-6dee271379d2.png)

You will got huge performances problems identified, intellisense will completely crash in "loading ..." state, and the whole computer will slow down.

Processes stay as ghost even if vscode is closed.

data.title: Not to escape debuggerPath of pipeTransport in launch.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version:
RHEL 7.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Generate launch.json to set up remote debug configuration.

```
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [        
    {
        "name": ".NET Core Docker Remote Attach",
        "type": "coreclr",
        "request": "attach",
        "processId": "21",
        "pipeTransport": {
            "pipeProgram": "docler",
            "pipeArgs": [ "exec", "remotedebug-1-mispn"],
            "debuggerPath": "/opt/app-root/src/clrdbg/clrdbg",
            "pipeCwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
        },
        "sourceFileMap": {
            "/opt/app-root/src": "${workspaceRoot}"
        }
    }
  ]
}
```

2. Start debug ".NET Core Docker Remote Attach"

3. Failed to execute docker command. This is because VS Code escape the debuggerPath with parameters.
```
"docker" exec remotedebug-1-mispn "/opt/app-root/src/clrdbg/clrdbg --interpreter=mi"
```

The docker command recognizes "/opt/app-root/src/clrdbg/clrdbg --interpreter=mi" as one file path, then failed. I'm not sure which version, but the previous version (maybe 1.10.x-insider or 1.9.x-insider) VS Code didn't escape with option but not escaped like below.
```
"docker" exec remotedebug-1-mispn /opt/app-root/src/clrdbg/clrdbg --interpreter=mi
```

I submitted to StackOverflow as a question. But, I found this issue occurred with not only "oc (OpenShit CLI)" command but also "docker" command. So I decided to submit this issue as a bug.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42731558/how-not-to-escape-debuggerpath-of-pipetransport-in-launch-json

This issue prevents me from executing remote debug from VS Code to docker.

data.title: Opened editors view: weird behaviour when deleting a file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. configure `"workbench.editor.closeOnFileDelete": false`
2. open a file
3. delete it on disk

=> you should see the file tab getting a "(file deleted on disk)" annotation
=> somehow the opened editors view still shows the entry but you cannot click it and it also does not update until you open another file

data.title: Performance tests inside unit tests?
data.body: I see that we run a textsearch performance test and quickopen performance test as part of our unit tests. Do we really need to run those everytime? I think we should extract them towards code-performance-test.sh or similar to keep our unit tests execute fast.

data.title: wrong editor/context format of command shortcut text
data.body:
When there is a keybinding defined like: 
```ctrl+c ctrl+c```
the format of the editor context is somehow wrong (see screenshot).
![shortcut format](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3279247/23847635/ab490db2-07d3-11e7-9188-662e439ff7d0.png)
The text format of the keybinding is the same as the command title. If I change this back to a single
```ctrl+c```
everything looks as usual.
![shortcut format correct](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3279247/23847678/de159bb6-07d3-11e7-9df7-392994e9a99e.png)

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 7
